dismissalText.long: c Anamul Haque b Ebadot Hossain
dismissalText.commentary: KL Rahul c Anamul Haque b Ebadot Hossain 73 (70b 5x4 4x6 133m) SR: 104.28

dismissalComment.html: Third for Ebadot and the short ball does the trick, again! Banged in short outside off, Rahul fetches for it but can only get a top-edge. The ball goes to fine leg, who takes a good catch low to his left. Important knock by Rahul, but he dearly needed to carry on. Bangladesh are elated, as they should.

images.caption: KL Rahul waged a lone battle as wickets fell around him
images.longCaption: KL Rahul waged a lone battle as wickets fell around him, Bangladesh vs India, 1st ODI, Dhaka, December 4, 2022

dismissalText.commentary: Rohit Sharma b Shakib Al Hasan 27 (31b 4x4 1x6 47m) SR: 87.09

dismissalComment.html: WHAT A RIPPER! Goes on with the arm and beats Rohit all ends up. Tossed up on middle, Rohit was looking for it to turn but that went on with the arm sneaking in between bat and pad. The stumps are left in a mess, and the crowd is elated.

images.caption: Litton Das held on to a screamer at cover to send Virat Kohli back off Shakib Al Hasan
images.longCaption: Litton Das held on to a screamer at cover to send Virat Kohli back off Shakib Al Hasan, Bangladesh vs India, 1st ODI, Dhaka, December 4, 2022

headshotImage.caption: RG Sharma headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: RG Sharma headshot

dismissalComment.html: WHAT A RIPPER! Goes on with the arm and beats Rohit all ends up. Tossed up on middle, Rohit was looking for it to turn but that went on with the arm sneaking in between bat and pad. The stumps are left in a mess, and the crowd is elated.

headshotImage.caption: V Kohli headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: V Kohli headshot

dismissalComment.html: Litton Das, that is an absolute stunner! Kohli is stunned, the on-air commentators are stunned, and frankly I am as well. Kohli looks for a drive to the tossed-up ball, does not reach the pitch of it and pushes it uppishly to the right of Litton at extra cover. Kohli would have thought he'd placed it well, but the captain flings to right, one-handed, almost parallel to the ground to pluck out a ripper of a catch. Almost goalkeeper-style. Well, 'tis the season, isn't it! Gets mobbed by his team-mates.

headshotImage.caption: Washington Sundar player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Washington Sundar player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Shakib comes back, Shakib makes the breakthrough! What a cricketer! Washington was getting itchy having not got any boundaries. Lets out a reverse sweep, but does not find the placement. Hits it straight to point, who takes a comfortable catch. Shakib celebrates and Bangladesh get the wicket just when India seem to be rebuilding again.

headshotImage.caption: Shardul Thakur player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Shardul Thakur player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Shakib is all over India! Angles this in off and gets it to turn away just a tad. But that is enough to beat the bat of Thakur, and hit off pole. The batter had absolutely no clue of that. Shakib waves Thakur goodbye, and why not. Best figures by a Bangladesh spinner against India.

headshotImage.caption: Deepak Chahar player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Deepak Chahar player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Arm ball, raps Chahar on the pads, loud appeal for lbw and the umpire agrees! Was there some bat though? Chahar thinks so, and he sends it upstairs. Nope, replays confirm that it was pad first. The ball would have shattered the middle pole. Five for Shakib! What an absolute gem of a cricketer this man is for Bangladesh. Chahar was looking to go forward to everything. Shakib was too good for him.

headshotImage.caption: Shreyas Iyer player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Shreyas Iyer player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: top edge, and taken by Mushfiq! Ebadot continues bowling short to Iyer, and he fails to time his pull. The ball ended outside off, but Iyer almost seemed like dragging the ball from there to pull to the leg side. The ball flew off the top edge, as Mushfiq went a few steps back and to his right to take a simple catch. A set batter is gone, and India have to rebuild again

headshotImage.caption: Shahbaz Ahmed, player page headshot cutout 2022
headshotImage.longCaption: Shahbaz Ahmed, player page headshot cutout 2022

dismissalComment.html: Another one bites the dust! Not the best outing for Shahbaz. Was a nothing delivery, but he does not get the timing. Back of a length outside off, he was looking for the gap through covers, can only mis-hit it straight to Shakib at cover, who takes a good catch low to his right.

headshotImage.caption: KL Rahul player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: KL Rahul player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Third for Ebadot and the short ball does the trick, again! Banged in short outside off, Rahul fetches for it but can only get a top-edge. The ball goes to fine leg, who takes a good catch low to his left. Important knock by Rahul, but he dearly needed to carry on. Bangladesh are elated, as they should.

headshotImage.caption: Mohammed Siraj player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mohammed Siraj player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: All over! Ebadot gets four and out comes the salute. The short ball does the trick for him again. Banged in short on off, Siraj backs away, looking to pull it away. He gets it off the splice of the blade with the ball travelling all the way to deep cover, who completes a simple catch. Second-lowest total for India against Bangladesh in ODIs.

dismissalText.commentary: Shikhar Dhawan b Mehidy Hasan Miraz 7 (17b 1x4 0x6 28m) SR: 41.17

dismissalComment.html: First bit of innovation brings about Dhawan's downfall! The dot-ball pressure gets to Dhawan and he departs. Flatter on off, he goes for the reverse sweep, but the ball bounces a bit more, hits him on the wrist and ricochets back onto the stumps. Bog wicket for Bangladesh. Mehidy is elated, and why won't he!

dismissalText.commentary: Litton Das c Rahul b Washington Sundar 41 (63b 3x4 1x6 98m) SR: 65.07

dismissalComment.html: Has he got something on it? The finger goes up and Litton is walking back. Washington has struck out of nowhere. A little slower on off, the ball turns and catches the glove of Litton who was looking to glance it down to fine leg. Rahul does really well to move to his left and snap it up. Such an important wicket for India,

commentPreTextItems.html: Rohit speaks with Chahar. The field comes in. Everyone on the offside is in. Midwicket in, deep square leg and long on are back.

commentTextItems.html: Mehidy, the hero! What a champion, what a player, what a match! Second-highest 10th wicket partnership for Bangladesh in ODIs. They have won this game out of nowhere. This is a famous win and all credit to Mehidy, who did not lose cool, and of course Mustafizur, who seriously deserves a promotion. Coming back to the ball. It was a length ball, outside off. Miraz just lofts it through covers and celebrations follow. Helmet off, Mehidy runs to his team-mates who are absolutely elated.

commentPostTextItems.html: What a game! One that the Bangladesh fans will talk about for years to come. Can't say the same about India. In case you missed it (seriously, where were you!), read all about it in Karthik's report. Hope you enjoyed our coverage of the game. We will be back in a couple of days' time, with India looking to get one back and Bangladesh keen to make it 2-0 and wrap up the series. Till then, on behalf of Himanshu and Thilak, this is me, Ashish, signing off. Ciao!

Litton Das, the winning captain: Very happy. When I was in the dressing room, I was really nervous, but the way Fizz and Miraz batted, I enjoyed it a lot. The bowlers bowled really well at the start. When me and Shakib were batting, we thought we could chase it easily. But when we got out, it got tricky. I had faith on the others but I have no words to describe this feeling. Congratulations to Miraz.

Mehidy Hasan Miraz is the Player of the Match : Thanks to Allah. I am really excited. Mustafizur and I just thought that we need to believe. I just told him to stay calm and play 20 balls. I am really enjoying bowling. The wicket in the morning was a bit tricky, and I enjoyed bowling. This performance is really memorable for me.

First up, Rohit Sharma, the India captain : It was a very close game. We did very well to come back into the game. We did not bat well. We bowled pretty well and kept them under pressure till the end. They held their nerves in the backend. If you look back at how we bowled, of course the last few overs, we would have liked to get a wicket. We kept taking wickets all through. It wasn't enough runs. Another 30-40 runs would have made a difference. With KL and Washy, we could have got there. Unfortunately, we lost wickets in the middle, and it is not easy to come back. The pitch was a bit challenging, the odd ball was turning. You have to understand how to play. There are no excuses, we are used to such types of conditions. We need to look at how to bat against their spinners in these conditions. The genes are there, these guys grew up playing in such conditions. It is all about handling pressure. Once you do, it gives you confidence. It is important to learn how to handle those pressure situations. Hopefully, we change things around in the next game.
This is the fourth-highest 10th wicket partnership in a successful ODI chase, says Sampath.
ShahSafeer : "Switched on to TV when Mehidy hit those two sixes off Sen bowling, I thought he was hitting shots for a fun but surprised us all with a beautiful win, one for ages for BD cricket! "
JOYDEEP GILL: "Ind conceded 17 extras causing lose them this match"

7.45pm A game that ebbed and flowed all the way through ends up in Bangladesh's favour, courtesy an an almost unbelievable 51-run last-wicket stand between Mehidy Hasan Miraz and Mustafizur Rahman. In all fairness, Bangladesh should have won this game quite easily, but defending 187, India came out all guns firing. Deepak Chahar picked a wicket of the first ball, Mohammed Siraj was exceptional in the middle overs, so was Washington Sundar. The experienced batters, Litton Das, Shakib Al Hasan, Mushfiqur Rahim, and Mahmudullah, all got starts, but none of them could carry on till the end. Bangladesh were 95 for 3, then slipped to 136 for 9 in a dramatic collapse. It seemed the game would be over, everyone did, barring two men - Mehidy and Fizz. The duo added 51 off 41 balls to take their side home. The celebrations told the entire story. How costly were the fielding lapses. For a team that plays under high-pressure situations all the time, India just lost the plot and couldn't take the pressure. There were drop catches, fielding lapses, overthrows, wayward bowling.
Ruthvik: "Baffling to no use of Sundar at the fag end and Rohit persisting with fast medium bowlers. Ordinary stuff captaincy." The dew was a factor, I suspect. It was getting tough to grip the ball.
Ashfaq: "Winning runs was a four. Not a single so correct the commentary pls" They completed the single before the ball hit the boundary cushions.
Naman: "India's inability to clean up the tail continues"

commentPreTextItems.html: Prince: "India have just bowled poorly in the last 4-5 overs. Kept bowling short. No Yorkers. Just lost the plot."

commentTextItems.html: Scores are level! Or are they? Has Fizz grounded his bat? So many questions. Nope, he has made it. On a length on the pads, he clips it to midwicket and they run through for a run. There was a direct hit, but Fizz makes it. 50 partnership up for Bangladesh.

commentPreTextItems.html: Two to win, one for a tie. Fizz to take strike.

commentTextItems.html: Banged in short, he goes for the pull. Misses it completely.

Banged in short, is that the game? Nope! He swivels and pulls it to deep midwicket, who does well running his right. They take a run. Haaang on a minute, Chahar has over-stepped! A free hit at such a crucial juncture.

commentPreTextItems.html: H. Prasanna : "Why do keep bowling short to Miraz? They bowled brilliant lengths throughout the game!"

commentTextItems.html: Misses out! That was the opportunity to close the game. Short, wide outside the off stump. He looks for the cut again, but I suspect he tried to go very hard at it. Misses
Banged in short, he was looking for the pull, but sensibly, sways out of the line.

commentPreTextItems.html: Just 8 to win for Bangladesh. How things change in a matter of overs! Can these two hold their nerves? These last eight runs, they are going to be the toughest. They can get these in singles, pretty easily.,

commentTextItems.html: They are within striking distance! Short, wide, he cuts it hard past deep third and the ball races along the ground. Chahar has lost the plot
Slower back of a length ball well outside off. Miraz gets well across and gently pull it to deep midwicket.

commentTextItems.html: Swing and a miss! Short of a length outside off, he shapes up for the pull but the ball does not get up as much. He misses
Nine to win! It's down in single figures. On a length outside off, he opens the face of the bat and gets it down to third man
A glance and four runs! They need 10 more. A despairing dive can't save the boundary. The angles gets it on the pads, he gets a tickle and the ball races to the fine leg fence.
Short of a good length just outside off, he gets across and presents another solid block. Glove up, saying no run!

commentPreTextItems.html: 14 to win. Shardul from around the wicket.

commentTextItems.html: Length angling into the batter, who is right behind it. Defends back to the bowler. The crowd is getting right behind Fizz.

Another fielding lapse and four runs is the result! Slower short of a length ball hip-high. He swivels and pulls it to the right of deep square leg, who runs, puts in a dive but lets the ball through. But, that means, Fizz will have to face the start of the next over. Can this be a blessing in disguise for India?

commentTextItems.html: Punches it so nicely. Stands tall to the back of a length ball and places it wide of deep point. Oh, there are overthrows. The pressure getting to India? No one was backing up at the bowler's end. They concede an extra run.
Almost chops it on! Back of a length ball outside off, he gets an inside edge perilously close to the stumps.
Another boundary! What's happening here? Back of a length but the width, that's the issue. Mehidy dances down the track and has hack at it. Flays it over point and the ball trickles to the fence.
Slower ball outside off, he spots it early, gets across, and scoops it fine past short fine and keeper
Back of a length ball outside off, he swishes at it and even though is caught with Dhawan going back from cover, doesn't matter. They don't take a run
Oh, what happened there? Chahar tries the knuckle ball that goes horribly wrong. A high full toss around shoulder high results that he can only pat to extra cover

dismissalText.commentary: Virat Kohli c Litton Das b Shakib Al Hasan 9 (15b 1x4 0x6 22m) SR: 60

dismissalComment.html: Litton Das, that is an absolute stunner! Kohli is stunned, the on-air commentators are stunned, and frankly I am as well. Kohli looks for a drive to the tossed-up ball, does not reach the pitch of it and pushes it uppishly to the right of Litton at extra cover. Well, 'tis the season, isn't it! Gets mobbed by his team-mates.

dismissalText.commentary: Deepak Chahar lbw b Shakib Al Hasan 0 (3b 0x4 0x6 6m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: Arm ball, raps Chahar on the pads, loud appeal for lbw and the umpire agrees! Was there some bat though? Chahar thinks so, and he sends it upstairs. Nope, replays confirm that it was pad first. The ball would have shattered the middle pole. Five for Shakib! What an absolute gem of a cricketer this man is for Bangladesh. Chahar was looking to go forward to everything. Shakib was too good for him.

headshotImage.caption: Shakib Al Hasan headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: Shakib Al Hasan headshot

dismissalText.commentary: Shardul Thakur b Shakib Al Hasan 2 (3b 0x4 0x6 6m) SR: 66.66

dismissalComment.html: Shakib is all over India! Angles this in off and gets it to turn away just a tad. But that is enough to beat the bat of Thakur, and hit off pole. The batter had absolutely no clue of that. Shakib waves Thakur goodbye, and why not. Best figures by a Bangladesh spinner against India.

headshotImage.longCaption: Deepak Chahar player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Deepak Chahar player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Deepak Chahar player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Shakib Al Hasan headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: Shakib Al Hasan headshot

dismissalText.commentary: Deepak Chahar lbw b Shakib Al Hasan 0 (3b 0x4 0x6 6m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: Arm ball, raps Chahar on the pads, loud appeal for lbw and the umpire agrees! Was there some bat though? Chahar thinks so, and he sends it upstairs. Nope, replays confirm that it was pad first. The ball would have shattered the middle pole. Five for Shakib! What an absolute gem of a cricketer this man is for Bangladesh. Chahar was looking to go forward to everything. Shakib was too good for him.

dismissalText.long: c Anamul Haque b Ebadot Hossain
dismissalText.commentary: KL Rahul c Anamul Haque b Ebadot Hossain 73 (70b 5x4 4x6 133m) SR: 104.28

dismissalComment.html: Third for Ebadot and the short ball does the trick, again! Banged in short outside off, Rahul fetches for it but can only get a top-edge. The ball goes to fine leg, who takes a good catch low to his left. Important knock by Rahul, but he dearly needed to carry on. Bangladesh are elated, as they should.

images.caption: KL Rahul waged a lone battle as wickets fell around him
images.longCaption: KL Rahul waged a lone battle as wickets fell around him, Bangladesh vs India, 1st ODI, Dhaka, December 4, 2022

dismissalText.commentary: Mohammed Siraj c Mahmudullah b Ebadot Hossain 9 (20b 1x4 0x6 33m) SR: 45

dismissalComment.html: All over! Ebadot gets four and out comes the salute. The short ball does the trick for him again. Banged in short on off, Siraj backs away, looking to pull it away. He gets it off the splice of the blade with the ball travelling all the way to deep cover, who completes a simple catch. Second-lowest total for India against Bangladesh in ODIs.

dismissalComment.html: gone first ball! Tickled to the lone slip. A vertical seam ball, and on a good length just outside off, straightens to end close to off stump. dismissalText.commentary: Litton Das c Rahul b Washington Sundar 41 (63b 3x4 1x6 98m) SR: 65.07

dismissalComment.html: Has he got something on it? The finger goes up and Litton is walking back. Washington has struck out of nowhere. A little slower on off, the ball turns and catches the glove of Litton who was looking to glance it down to fine leg. Rahul does really well to move to his left and snap it up. Such an important wicket for India,

dismissalText.long: c Washington Sundar b Mohammed Siraj
dismissalText.commentary: Anamul Haque c Washington Sundar b Mohammed Siraj 14 (29b 2x4 0x6 46m) SR: 48.27

dismissalComment.html: chipped to midwicket! Siraj finally has his reward, even if it hasn't come via the outside edge. Sundar was actually placed more as a short midwicket, as he went slightly to his left to take it. Good length ball ending around middle stump, as Anamul went deep in the crease to flick it aerially. Siraj strikes, and India get another one in the mandatory powerplay

headshotImage.caption: V Kohli headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: V Kohli headshot

dismissalText.commentary: Shakib Al Hasan c Kohli b Washington Sundar 29 (38b 3x4 0x6 69m) SR: 76.31

dismissalComment.html: Brilliance from Kohli! Oh, that will make it to the social media handles very soon, I reckon. And deserves to. Shakib wasn't reading Washington very well. Once again, the bowler shortens his length just a touch. Shakib looks to drive on the up, does not get all of it and Kohli at extra cover leaps to his right and plucks out a one-handed stunner . These are the types of catches that change games. Can India stage a comeback from here?

images.caption: Virat Kohli celebrates after his screamer to dismiss Shakib Al Hasan
images.longCaption: Virat Kohli celebrates after his screamer to dismiss Shakib Al Hasan, Bangladesh vs India, 1st ODI,  Mirpur, December 04, 2022

headshotImage.caption: Mohammed Siraj player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mohammed Siraj player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Mushfiqur Rahim b Mohammed Siraj 18 (45b 0x4 0x6 75m) SR: 40

dismissalComment.html: gone, chopped on! The off stump is uprooted. Two wickets in two balls for India. Siraj is over the moon, and why not? It was on the shorter side of a good length outside off, and darted back in sharply even with good bounce. The ball ended on top of off stump, as Mushfiq tried to guide that towards point or deep third, only to get a bottom edge and widen the crack of this game

headshotImage.caption: Shardul Thakur player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Shardul Thakur player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Mahmudullah lbw b Thakur 14 (35b 0x4 0x6 56m) SR: 40

dismissalComment.html: Thakur is pleading for it to be given out, and it is given leg before. But Mahmudullah reviews. Scrambled seam, and on a fullish length while heading down the leg side. He misses his flick, and is struck around leg stump. Replays show it would have clipped the side of leg stump, and returns umpire's call. The decision stays, and India hit back to disrupt a steady stand

headshotImage.longCaption: Mohammed Siraj player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Afif Hossain c Mohammed Siraj b Sen 6 (12b 0x4 0x6 19m) SR: 50

dismissalComment.html: taken with a juggle or two at deep third! Siraj the man in the deep, as he moved to his left, with the ball going through his reverse-cupped hands to hit him close to his chest, only for it to pop back. Sen gets his first ODI wicket. He bowled full and wide of off, inviting Afif to chase it, which he did. Afif ended up lofting it high while playing away from his body, as the pace on the ball took it to deep third. India take another step big step forward

dismissalText.commentary: Ebadot Hossain hit wicket b Sen 0 (3b 0x4 0x6 5m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: he is hit wicket! And that means Kohli is the most excited man on the field at the moment. But replays will still be looked at, which indeed confirm that he has tripped over his off stump. Ebadot was standing very deep in the crease, and got a little across to try and clip this back of a length ball down the leg side. He got bat to ball, but alas!

dismissalText.commentary: Hasan Mahmud lbw b Mohammed Siraj 0 (2b 0x4 0x6 7m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: Loud appeal for lbw and the finger goes up! Mahmud has taken the review, though. He does not look at all confident. Length ball that seams back into the batter, who is trapped on the crease and has his bat nowhere close to the ball. This is not looking good. Yep, ball-tracker confirms that would have thudded into middle and leg stump. The writing, it is firmly on the wall now.

dismissalText.commentary: Litton Das c Rahul b Washington Sundar 41 (63b 3x4 1x6 98m) SR: 65.07

dismissalComment.html: Has he got something on it? The finger goes up and Litton is walking back. Washington has struck out of nowhere. A little slower on off, the ball turns and catches the glove of Litton who was looking to glance it down to fine leg. Rahul does really well to move to his left and snap it up. Such an important wicket for India,

images.caption: Washington Sundar celebrates after dismissing Litton Das
images.longCaption: Washington Sundar celebrates after dismissing Litton Das, Bangladesh vs India, 1st ODI,  Mirpur, December 04, 2022

headshotImage.caption: V Kohli headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: V Kohli headshot

dismissalText.commentary: Shakib Al Hasan c Kohli b Washington Sundar 29 (38b 3x4 0x6 69m) SR: 76.31

dismissalComment.html: Brilliance from Kohli! Oh, that will make it to the social media handles very soon, I reckon. And deserves to. Shakib wasn't reading Washington very well. Once again, the bowler shortens his length just a touch. Shakib looks to drive on the up, does not get all of it and Kohli at extra cover leaps to his right and plucks out a one-handed stunner . These are the types of catches that change games. Can India stage a comeback from here?

dismissalText.commentary: Mahmudullah lbw b Thakur 14 (35b 0x4 0x6 56m) SR: 40

dismissalComment.html: Thakur is pleading for it to be given out, and it is given leg before. But Mahmudullah reviews. Scrambled seam, and on a fullish length while heading down the leg side. He misses his flick, and is struck around leg stump. Replays show it would have clipped the side of leg stump, and returns umpire's call. The decision stays, and India hit back to disrupt a steady stand

dismissalText.commentary: Mushfiqur Rahim b Mohammed Siraj 18 (45b 0x4 0x6 75m) SR: 40

dismissalComment.html: gone, chopped on! The off stump is uprooted. Two wickets in two balls for India. Siraj is over the moon, and why not? It was on the shorter side of a good length outside off, and darted back in sharply even with good bounce. The ball ended on top of off stump, as Mushfiq tried to guide that towards point or deep third, only to get a bottom edge and widen the crack of this game

dismissalText.commentary: Afif Hossain c Mohammed Siraj b Sen 6 (12b 0x4 0x6 19m) SR: 50

dismissalComment.html: taken with a juggle or two at deep third! Siraj the man in the deep, as he moved to his left, with the ball going through his reverse-cupped hands to hit him close to his chest, only for it to pop back. Sen gets his first ODI wicket. He bowled full and wide of off, inviting Afif to chase it, which he did. Afif ended up lofting it high while playing away from his body, as the pace on the ball took it to deep third. India take another step big step forward

dismissalText.commentary: Ebadot Hossain hit wicket b Sen 0 (3b 0x4 0x6 5m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: he is hit wicket! And that means Kohli is the most excited man on the field at the moment. But replays will still be looked at, which indeed confirm that he has tripped over his off stump. Ebadot was standing very deep in the crease, and got a little across to try and clip this back of a length ball down the leg side. He got bat to ball, but alas!

dismissalText.commentary: Hasan Mahmud lbw b Mohammed Siraj 0 (2b 0x4 0x6 7m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: Loud appeal for lbw and the finger goes up! Mahmud has taken the review, though. He does not look at all confident. Length ball that seams back into the batter, who is trapped on the crease and has his bat nowhere close to the ball. This is not looking good. Yep, ball-tracker confirms that would have thudded into middle and leg stump. The writing, it is firmly on the wall now.
